Package net.royalur.rules.state

Interface GameState<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>

Type Parameters:
P - The type of pieces that are stored on the board in this game state.
S - The type of state that is stored for each player.
R - The type of rolls that may be stored in this game state.
All Known Subinterfaces:
ActionGameState<P,S,R,A>, OngoingGameState<P,S,R>, PlayableGameState<P,S,R,A>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGameState, AbstractOngoingGameState, MovedGameState, RolledGameState, WaitingForMoveGameState, WaitingForRollGameState, WinGameState
public interface GameState<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>
A game state represents a single point within a game.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    describe()
    Generates an English text description of the state of the game.
    Board<P>
    getBoard()
    Get the state of the pieces on the board.
    S
    getDarkPlayer()
    Get the state of the dark player.
    S
    getLightPlayer()
    Get the state of the light player.
    default S
    getPlayer(PlayerType player)
    Retrieves the state of the player player.
    boolean
    isFinished()
    Returns whether this state represents a finished game.
    boolean
    isPlayable()
    Returns whether this state is a valid state to be played from.
